DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act Certification Laboratory Identifier Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the name or unique identifier of a facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products and is certified as compliant with the Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act Certification Laboratory Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the name or unique identifier of a facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products and is certified as compliant with the Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act Certification Laboratory
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed, and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.:A designation earned by a person that indicates that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of the certifying body.  Similarly, a product or process can achieve certification indicating its suitability for a specific purpose.:Laboratory; a workplace for the conduct of scientific research.

Concepts.definition: A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.

The process by which a person demonstrates specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of a certifying body.  Similarly, the process by which a product or process can achieve certification indicating its suitability for a specific purpose.
A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.

Property.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name or ID of the laboratory.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A language unit by which a person or thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.

ValueDomain.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
